metadata.title: CVE-2022-24737 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: HTTPie is a command-line HTTP client. HTTPie has the practical concept ofsessions, which help users to persistently store some of the state thatbelongs to the outgoing requests and incoming responses on the disk forfurther usage. Before 3.1.0, HTTPie didnâ€˜t distinguish between cookies andhosts they belonged. This behavior resulted in the exposure of some cookieswhen there are redirects originating from the actual host to a third partywebsite. Users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds.

criterions.comment: httpie: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
